data.title: Daniel Kluger
data.meta_description: Daniel Kluger is a composer, whose experience as an orchestrator, music producer and sound designer uniquely informs his success at creating music for theater, film, and media.
data.text:
Daniel Kluger is a composer, music producer, orchestrator and sound designer.

Known for his Tony, Grammy and Olivier nominated bluegrass orchestrations of the Broadway revival of OKLAHOMA!, Kluger’s musical work spans a range from electronic dance music, to neoclassical chamber composition, jazz and atmospheric synth soundscapes. He has created original scores for dozens of award-winning theater projects, films and podcasts.

Most recently Kluger wrote the original score for Cole Escola’s Broadway comedy OH MARY!

Other broadway credits include the world premieres of THE SOUND INSIDE, SIGNIFICANT OTHER, Seawall / A Life, and the revival of MARVIN’S ROOM, in addition to countless Off-Broadway productions. Film credits include THE COURTROOM, A Christmas Carol, Hello Again, Health to the King, among others.. Podcast scores include Audible’s THE MIRANDA OBSESSION, THE GUILTY, OFFENSE, and Ken Urban’s VAPOR TRAIL.

Kluger collaborates with some of New York’s finest musicians, including Nathan Koci, Bryan Carter, Clara Kennedy, Sam Sadigursky, Riley Mulherkar, and the International Contemporary Ensemble. An advocate for the importance of live music and musicianship in theater scoring, Kluger has taught music production both privately and at the David Geffen School of Drama at Yale.

Kluger is Resident Composer and Music Producer at Renaissance Recording, a newly reopened studio in Hell’s Kitchen run by Grammy award-winning engineers Ian Kagey and Derik Lee. Originally built and run by John Kilgore, the studio has served Broadway, film and music projects for 20 years, and under this new leadership is being maintained and upgraded to serve a new generation of theater and film music production.

Click here for full CV.

Kluger is Resident Composer and Music Producer in Studio B of Renaissance Recording, a newly reopened studio in Hell’s Kitchen run by Grammy award winning engineers Ian Kagey and Derik Lee. Originally built and run by John Kilgore, the studio has served Broadway, film and music projects for 20 years, and under this new leadership is being maintained and upgraded to serve a new generation of theater and film music production.

Kluger’s mixing studio was home to legendary polymath producer Hal Wilner.

The listening setup features Focal Trio6 Be monitors, calibrated with a Trinnov room correction system. The environment is ideal for writing sessions, producing, editing and mixing.

Steps away from Renaissance Recording’s versatile live room and world class mic collection, projects can be serviced from inception to final delivery.

For inquiries about working with Kluger, please get in touch via email: daniel.kluger@icloud.com.
